doc.after: Franz Boas established academic anthropology in the United States in opposition to this sort of evolutionary perspective His approach was empirical skeptical of overgeneralizations and eschewed attempts to establish universal laws For example Boas studied immigrant children to demonstrate that biological race was not immutable and that human conduct and behavior resulted from nurture rather than nature
